channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Vince Zampella, video game pioneer behind megahit Call of Duty, dies at 55
item.description: One of Vince Zampella's crowning achievements was the creation of the Call of Duty franchise, which has sold more than half a billion games worldwide.

item.title: A diplomat's tears, 200 snake bites, drone pix: Goats and Soda's top stories in 2025
item.description: Our most popular global health and development stories in 2025 covered the human impact of the upheaval in U.S. foreign aid, surprising news about fam...

item.title: Justice Department releases more Epstein files and some mention Trump
item.description: The Department of Justice has been publicly posting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation since Friday.

item.title: Student loan borrowers in default may soon see their wages garnished
item.description: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paus...

item.title: Scientists learn more about how human embryos implant using artificial wombs
item.description: Scientists have developed an experimental way to study how human embryos implant in a uterus, which may provide new insights into why miscarriages occ...

item.title: Trump travelled on Epstein's plane more than previously thought, prosecutor says
item.description: The US president has long denied any wrongdoing in relation to late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Supreme Court says Trump can't deploy National Guard to Chicago for now
item.description: President Trump invoked a law called Title 10 to bring members of the Illinois National Guard under federal service over the objections of state and l...

item.title: Ukraine loses embattled eastern town
item.description: The capture of Siversk brings Russia closer to the last remaining "fortress belt" cities still in Ukrainian hands in the Donetsk region.

item.title: Even store Santas are struggling to find a job these days
item.description: Job listings for store Santas have plunged in recent years as more families shop online and retailers look to contain costs, a new analysis found.

item.title: Gunmen abduct 28 Muslim travellers in central Nigeria
item.description: The victims, including women and children, were ambushed on their way to a religious festival.

item.title: Taylor Swift donates $1 million to Feeding America, group says
item.description: Feeding America's CEO said the organization is "incredibly grateful" for Taylor Swift's large donation.

item.title: US economy grows at fastest pace in two years
item.description: Strong consumer spending helps the US economy grow at a faster rate than expected.

item.title: Libya's army chief killed in air crash in Turkey
item.description: Signal was earlier lost with a jet that took off from Ankara with Gen Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad and four others on board.

item.title: DOJ releases huge new set of Epstein files with many mentions of Trump
item.description: The Justice Department early Tuesday released more than 11,000 additional documents and photos from the Jeffrey Epstein files. Follow live updates her...

item.title: Details on U.S. strike against alleged "low-profile" drug vessel in Pacific

item.title: An American Dream at risk: What happens to a small Nebraska town when 3,200 workers lose their jobs
